camel.source.path.accountName.name: camel.source.path.accountName
camel.source.path.accountName.description: Azure account name to be used for authentication with azure blob services

camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient
camel.source.endpoint.autoDiscoverClient.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.source.endpoint.blobName.name: camel.source.endpoint.blobName
camel.source.endpoint.blobName.description: The blob name, required for consumer. However on producer, is only required for the operations on the blob level

camel.source.endpoint.blobOffset.name: camel.source.endpoint.blobOffset
camel.source.endpoint.blobOffset.description: Set the blob offset for the upload or download operations, default is 0

camel.source.endpoint.blobServiceClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.blobServiceClient
camel.source.endpoint.blobServiceClient.description: Client to a storage account. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers. This client contains operations on a service account. Operations on a container are available on BlobContainerClient through getBlobContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient through getBlobContainerClient(String).getBlobClient(String).

camel.source.endpoint.blobType.name: camel.source.endpoint.blobType
camel.source.endpoint.blobType.description: The blob type in order to initiate the appropriate settings for each blob type One of: [blockblob] [appendblob] [pageblob]

camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.name: camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRead
camel.source.endpoint.closeStreamAfterRe.description: Close the stream after read or keep it open, default is true

camel.source.endpoint.credentials.name: camel.source.endpoint.credentials
camel.source.endpoint.credentials.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

camel.source.endpoint.dataCount.name: camel.source.endpoint.dataCount
camel.source.endpoint.dataCount.description: How many bytes to include in the range. Must be greater than or equal to 0 if specified.

camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.name: camel.source.endpoint.fileDir
camel.source.endpoint.fileDir.description: The file directory where the downloaded blobs will be saved to, this can be used in both, producer and consumer

camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerPage.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerPage
camel.source.endpoint.maxResultsPerPage.description: Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return, including all BlobPrefix elements. If the request does not specify maxResultsPerPage or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.

camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests
camel.source.endpoint.maxRetryRequests.description: Specifies the maximum number of additional HTTP Get requests that will be made while reading the data from a response body.

camel.source.endpoint.prefix.name: camel.source.endpoint.prefix
camel.source.endpoint.prefix.description: Filters the results to return only blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix. May be null to return all blobs.

camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.name: camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient
camel.source.endpoint.serviceClient.description: Client to a storage account. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers. This client contains operations on a service account. Operations on a container are available on BlobContainerClient through getBlobContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient through getBlobContainerClient(String).getBlobClient(String).

camel.source.endpoint.timeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeout
camel.source.endpoint.timeout.description: An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.name: camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.source.endpoint.basicPropertyBindi.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.source.endpoint.synchronous
camel.source.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.source.endpoint.accessKey.name: camel.source.endpoint.accessKey
camel.source.endpoint.accessKey.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure blob services

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.autoD.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.autoDiscoverClient
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.autoD.description: Setting the autoDiscoverClient mechanism, if true, the component will look for a client instance in the registry automatically otherwise it will skip that checking.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobN.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobName
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobN.description: The blob name, required for consumer. However on producer, is only required for the operations on the blob level

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobO.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobOffset
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobO.description: Set the blob offset for the upload or download operations, default is 0

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobT.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobType
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.blobT.description: The blob type in order to initiate the appropriate settings for each blob type One of: [blockblob] [appendblob] [pageblob]

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.close.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.closeStreamAfterRead
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.close.description: Close the stream after read or keep it open, default is true

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.crede.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.credentials
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.crede.description: StorageSharedKeyCredential can be injected to create the azure client, this holds the important authentication information

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.dataC.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.dataCount
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.dataC.description: How many bytes to include in the range. Must be greater than or equal to 0 if specified.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.fileD.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.fileDir
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.fileD.description: The file directory where the downloaded blobs will be saved to, this can be used in both, producer and consumer

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxRe.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxResultsPerPage
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxRe.description: Specifies the maximum number of blobs to return, including all BlobPrefix elements. If the request does not specify maxResultsPerPage or specifies a value greater than 5,000, the server will return up to 5,000 items.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxRe.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxRetryRequests
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.maxRe.description: Specifies the maximum number of additional HTTP Get requests that will be made while reading the data from a response body.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.prefi.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.prefix
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.prefi.description: Filters the results to return only blobs whose names begin with the specified prefix. May be null to return all blobs.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.servi.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.serviceClient
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.servi.description: Client to a storage account. This client does not hold any state about a particular storage account but is instead a convenient way of sending off appropriate requests to the resource on the service. It may also be used to construct URLs to blobs and containers. This client contains operations on a service account. Operations on a container are available on BlobContainerClient through getBlobContainerClient(String), and operations on a blob are available on BlobClient through getBlobContainerClient(String).getBlobClient(String).

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.timeo.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.timeout
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.timeo.description: An optional timeout value beyond which a RuntimeException will be raised.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.bridg.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.bridg.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.basic.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.basic.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.component.azure-storage-blob.acces.name: camel.component.azure-storage-blob.accessKey
camel.component.azure-storage-blob.acces.description: Access key for the associated azure account name to be used for authentication with azure blob services
